text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with watermelon agua fresca that's
right i'm finally posting a video for my
all-time favorite summertime drink and
the reason it's my favorite is because
when it's super hot humid and you're
totally parched there's just absolutely
nothing as refreshing as revitalizing
and as restorative is ice cold
watermelon juice but why settle for a
few precious tablespoons when you can
have a whole glass of this stuff all
right so let me show you how to do this
it is so easy and if you've not been
enjoying watermelon agua frescas you're
missing out on one of life's great
drinkable pleasures so we're going to
cut one seedless watermelon in half of
course we got to give it to you old
taste test see how sweet it is because
that's going to affect how much
sweetener we put in later so step one
we're going to scoop that out into a
blender by the way this is a fairly
standard size seedless watermelon and
half of this will make about one pitcher
of agua fresca so we're going to scoop
that into the blender and of course
you're going to want to get as much as
you can so go all the way down to the
rind you don't want the white parts but
if it's red or pink it should go in the
drink
sorry I just practicing for the next
Poetry Slam okay so scrape out as much
as you can and then we're going to head
over to the blender where we're going to
add a couple cups of water all right
this is not a smoothie this is not a
fruit juice this is supposed to be a
flavored water right aqua fresca means
fresh water so we're going to pour in
some cold water we're going to throw the
lid on and then just to be safe because
this is like three-quarters full I like
to put a towel on top just in case and I
know people say you look good wearing
anything but watermelon juice probably
not so much so throw a towel over that
start off on a lower speed and then go
to your high setting and liquefy this
stuff for a minute and do not let that
pale pink color scare you
that's just twelve to fourteen million
air bubbles in there but those will
settle and it will return back to that
stunning dark pink red watermelon color
that we all know and love all right so
once that's completely liquefied we're
going to put that through a strainer now
technically this step is optional but I
really like to do it some of my Mexican
friends say not to do it not necessary
but I do like to strain out the fibers
from those seeds so I pour mine through
a fine mesh strainer just use a spatula
to move it around it only takes like a
minute totally worth it in my opinion
and you'll see you'll trap a couple
tablespoons of the most fibrous bits so
I'm going to discard that and what I'm
left with is a beautiful bowl of the
most gorgeous watermelon juice you'll
ever see now if that foam bothers you
you can skim it off I don't think it
causes much of a problem but just by
habit I'm kind of a foam skimmer so suit
yourself all right so the first phase is
done and now to the second phase we're
going to sweeten this a little bit with
something called a simple syrup and I
know what you're thinking simple syrup
that sounds complicated well it's not
it's simply a mixture of half sugar and
half water so we're going to dump equal
parts sugar and water in a saucepan
we're going to place it over medium heat
and we're just going to let that come up
to temperature giving it a stir once in
a while until the sugar completely
dissolves and it does not need to come
to a simmer
all right just needs to get hot enough
for all that sugar to disappear and it
will look completely clear just like
that and once you get to that stage just
turn off the heat
let it cool to room temperature and then
based on how sweet your watermelon was
you'll have the simple syrup to that
juice and sweeten it to taste so on the
blog I'll put exactly how much sugar I
used but you're going to need to taste
and adjust you may need a little more
you may need a little less all right so
you're definitely in charge of how sweet
to make this you are the jefe of your
agua fresca okay so stir in your simple
syrup and once you're happy with the
sweetness level we're simply going to
transfer that into a pitcher and
refrigerate until needed
I suggest you serve this ice ice-cold
even though you're going to serve it on
ice cubes I think it should be cold when
you serve it and Here I am labeling it
into a pitcher and then I realized you
know you could just pour it all in right
which I did and I spilled a little but
that's okay I got plenty and like I said
a half watermelon that size will give
you just about one pitcher and that's
going to go in the fridge until I'm
ready to drink and you know what I'm
ready to drink so we're going to take a
tall glass filled with ice and we're
going to slowly ladle that watermelon
agua fresca over the cubes of course you
can just pour this in quickly but if
you're doing a video you want to ladle
it over slowly so you have time to be
asked about how awesome it looks which
it does you gottem it that looks
refreshing and as refreshing as it looks
it tastes even more refreshing so I'm
going to go ahead and enjoy some of this
with my freakishly expensive platinum
straw all right if all you have is a
plastic or paper straw that's fine
yes but I do prefer the platinum and
that's it there's not a lot else to say
just a remarkably refreshing drink just
the ice-cold pure essence of watermelon
which is the touch of extra sweetness
like I said to be gained this is just so
incredibly refreshing on a hot summer
day there's just nothing like it and of
course it's fine in a glass but if you
want to get extra fancy you could
actually use the smaller watermelons and
cut the tops off and use that to serve

feel free to play around a little bit in
